messages.message:
@Jonathan Shih @Aaron Tami @dlluncor Google OCR in Process Files is not handling rotated documents properly. See an example here:
https://www.instabase.com/apps/ocr/review-doc/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/moodys/ADM/kerry-test/data/out/s1_process_files/Al%20Madina%20Insurance%20Company%20SAOG-25.pdf.ibocr?i=0&ibflowresults=
It seems that all the words and numbers are read correctly, but how they are layout in the text file is completely wrong. I remember seeing this behavior a long time ago in DHL’s POC (upside down documents not layout properly) and thought we fixed it already.

We are using Google OCR for Moody’s POC and have a demo next Monday. While this is only one of their many documents sent to us, it’d be great if we can get this fixed soon…

I’m pretty sure it’s the same problem as this thread mentioned - goog ocr uses the bounding poly’s direction to suggest the documents’ orientation. Our layout algo is just not handling that properly.
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CFAC0MAKT/p1552938099040400
